medical_history.chief_complaint: Psychotic symptoms in end-stage Friedreich’s ataxia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began gradually with unusual behaviors, dysphoria, decreased energy, poor concentration, and anhedonia over several months. Recent decrease in function made him entirely dependent on care. He began to experience paranoia, delusions, and visual hallucinations.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient had Friedreich’s ataxia since age 5. Past medications included a 2-month trial of fluoxetine, 20 mg/day, with no improvement.
medical_history.family_history: Family history is notable for an older brother who also had Friedreich’s ataxia and died at age 34 from the illness.
